name: paroling
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
parole
to give someone parole: He was paroled from prison last year after serving about four years. I am not happy with the possibility he could be paroled in 20 years.
More examplesFewer examplesGenerally, the state paroles 11,000 to 12,000 inmates a year.Prison officials rarely parole the older inmates.Now Eric has been paroled and given a new identity.
